readings.title: Anna's Morning Routine
paragraphs: Anna wakes up at 6 a.m. every morning. She stretches, opens her window, and takes a deep breath.
She makes coffee and eats toast with jam while reading a news app.
After feeding her cat, she quickly gets dressed and leaves for work at 7:30.
She listens to relaxing music on the bus and plans her day mentally.

readings.title: A Visit to the Café
paragraphs: Sam loves quiet cafés. On Saturday mornings, he walks to his favorite one two blocks away.
He usually orders a cappuccino and a chocolate muffin and sits by the window.
While sipping his coffee, he reads or writes in a small notebook.
Sometimes, he just watches people walking by and enjoys the peaceful vibe.

What does he do at the café?
Where does he like to sit?

readings.title: Lost in a New City
paragraphs: Maria moved to Berlin for work. She was excited—but also a little nervous.
On her first weekend, she decided to explore the city without a map.
She walked for hours, discovering cozy streets, small bookstores, and beautiful parks.
At one point, she realized she was completely lost—but instead of panicking, she smiled and asked a kind couple for help.

How did Maria feel when she got lost?

readings.title: The Job Interview
paragraphs: James applied for a marketing position at a big tech company.
He wore a navy suit and practiced answering interview questions with his friend.
During the interview, he stayed calm and spoke clearly about his experience.
After it ended, he thanked the interviewer and walked out feeling confident—but nervous, too.

How did he feel after the interview?

readings.title: My Grandfather’s Letter
paragraphs: One summer, I found an old letter in my grandfather’s drawer. It was written in elegant handwriting and dated 1962.
The letter spoke about dreams, travel, and hard decisions he made when he was young.
I realized how brave he had been, and how similar his fears were to mine.
Reading that letter made me feel connected to him in a deep, quiet way.

questions.q: Where did the narrator find the letter?
When was the letter written?
How did the narrator feel after reading it?

readings.title: The Hacker
paragraphs: Late one night, Mira discovered that her company’s website had been hacked.
As the team’s cybersecurity lead, she quickly launched a full system diagnostic.
What she found shocked her: the breach was subtle, quiet—and brilliant.
It wasn’t just code. Whoever did this knew how people think. It felt personal.
Mira stared at the screen. This wasn’t about theft. It was a challenge.

readings.title: The Traveler’s Secret
paragraphs: In a quiet village nestled between mountains, a traveler checked into the inn with only a notebook and an old leather bag.
He spoke little, always smiling kindly, and wandered into the woods each morning.
One evening, curious children followed him and saw him planting small notes beneath trees.
Years later, when a terrible storm destroyed part of the forest, the notes were found—messages of wisdom, warnings, and love.
No one knew his name. But the village never forgot the man who left behind hope in ink.
